meanings.definition: A thing or event that existed before or logically precedes another.
meanings.sent1: The antecedent of the story was the mysterious disappearance of the treasure.
meanings.sent2: In the history lesson, the antecedent to the war was the tension between the two countries.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the antecedent of the crime scene quite intriguing.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins served as the antecedent to the modern city that now stands in its place.
meanings.sent5: The fading photograph was a poignant antecedent to the vibrant memories it held.

meanings.definition: A word, phrase, or clause referred to by a pronoun.
meanings.sent1: The antecedent in the sentence was 'it,' which referred to the mysterious object.
meanings.sent2: When Sarah said 'she,' the antecedent was her best friend, Lily.
meanings.sent3: The pronoun 'he' had an antecedent that made the whole class burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the pronoun 'they' had an antecedent that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The antecedent in the paragraph was 'this,' pointing to the main idea of the passage.
